 21 /**
 22  * Saves time from writing console.log, and writes complete functions
 23  */
 24 print = function () {
 25 	var str = ""
 26 	for (var i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++) {
 27 		if (i<arguments.length-1) {
 28 			str = str + arguments[i] +", ";
 29 		}
 30 		else {
 31 			str = str + arguments[i];
 32 		}
 33 	}
 34 	console.log(str);
 35 }
 36 
 37 
 38 /**
 39  * Saves time from writing console.log
 40  */
 41 printf = function () {
 42 	console.log(arguments);
 43 }

 50 /**
 51  * Class object to create classes
 52  * @class
 53  * @type {object}
 54  */
 55 Class = {};
 56 
 57 /**
 58  * The names of the class. For each extension there is a new name.
 59  * @type {string[]}
 60  */
 61 Class._names = ["Class"];
 62 
 63 /**
 64  * This is used to check if something is a class
 65  */
 66 Class._isClass = true;
 67 
 68 /**
 69  * Clones an existing class to create a new type of class.
 70  * @param  {string} name The name of the class
 71  * @return {Class}      A clone of the class
 72  */
 73 Class.extend = function (name) {
 74 	if (typeof(name) != "string") {
 75 		throw("Missing argument name in Class.extend");
 76 	}
 77 	var temp = {};
 78 	var supr = {};
 79 	for(var key in this) {
 80 		temp[key] = this.__clone(this[key]);
 81 		if (typeof(this[key])=="function" && key!="isClass") {
 82 			supr[key] = this.__clone(this[key],true);
 83 		}
 84 	}
 85 	temp.super = supr;
 86 	temp._names.push(name);
 87 	return temp;
 88 }
 89 
 90 /**
 91  * Creates a new instance of the class
 92  * @return {Class} The new instance of the class.
 93  */
 94 Class.new = function () {
 95 	var self = this.__clone(this);
 96 
 97 	if (!self.init) {
 98 		throw(this.type() + " has no constructor");
 99 	}
100 
101 	self.init.apply(self,arguments);
102 	
103 	return self;
104 }
105 
106 /**
107  * Copies the functions of a different class
108  * @param  {Class} obj   The class to implement
109  * @param  {boolean} force Whether to overwrite existing functions.
110  */
111 Class.implement = function (obj,force) {
112 	baa._checkType("Class",obj,"Class");
113 	baa._checkType("force",force,"boolean",null);
114 
115 	for(var key in obj) {
116 		if (this[key] == null || force) {
117 			this[key] = this.__clone(obj[key]);
118 		}
119 	}
120 }
121 
122 /**
123  * If something is specific class
124  * @example
125  * var rect = baa.rect.new();
126  * 
127  * //Returns true
128  * rect.is(baa.rect);
129  *
130  * //Returns true
131  * rect.is(baa.point);
132  *
133  * //Returns false
134  * rect.is(baa.sprite);
135  * 
136  * @param  {Class|string}  obj The value you want to check
137  * @return {boolean}  If it is of the type obj 
138  */
139 Class.is = function (obj) {
140 	baa._checkType("object",obj,"Class","string",null);
141 	if (obj == null) { return false; }
142 	var t = typeof(obj);
143 	for (var i = 0; i < this._names.length; i++) {
144 		if ((t == "object" && this._names[i] == obj.type()) || (obj == this._names[i])) {
145 			return true;
146 		}
147 	}
148 	return false;
149 }
150 
151 /**
152  * Returns the top-layer-type of the class
153  * @example
154  * // returns "baa.rectangle"
155  * baa.rectangle = baa.point.extend("baa.rectangle");
156  * baa.rectangle.type();
157  * @return {string} The type of the class
158  */
159 Class.type = function () {
160 	if (this._names[this._names.length-1].length == null) {
161 		throw("Add a type name! class.extend([TYPE])");
162 	}
163 	return this._names[this._names.length-1];
164 }
165 
166 /**
167  * Clones the properties of obj
168  * @private
169  * @param  {object} obj  The object to clone properties from
170  * @param  {boolean} supr If this is for extending or not
171  * @return {object}      The cloned object
172  */
173 Class.__clone = function(obj,supr) {
174 	if (supr) {
175 		var _super  = function () {
176 			var args = Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments);
177 			var _this = args[0];
178 			args.splice(0,1);
179 			// _this.__superWasCalled = true;
180 			return obj.apply(_this,args);
181 		}
182 		return _super;
183 	}
184 	if(obj == null || typeof(obj) != "object") {
185 		return obj;
186 	}
187 	if (Array.isArray(obj)) {
188 		return obj.slice(0);
189 	}
190 	var temp = obj.constructor();
191 	for(var key in obj) {
192 		if (key == "super") { continue; }
193 		if (key == "__clone" || key == "isClass" || key == "new" || key.substring(0,2) == "__") { continue; }
194 		temp[key] = this.__clone(obj[key],supr);
195 	}
196 	return temp;
197 }
198 
199 /**
200  * Ìf something is a class or not
201  * @param  {dynamic}  obj The value to check
202  * @return {boolean}   If it's a class or not
203  */
204 Class.isClass = function (obj) {
205 	if (obj!=null) {
206 		if (typeof(obj) == "object") {
207 			if (obj["_isClass"]) {
208 				return true;
209 			}
210 		}
211 	}
212 	return false;
213 }

220 var _baa_init = function () {
221 	baa.graphics.canvas = document.getElementById('canvas');
222 	baa.graphics._defaultCanvas = baa.graphics.canvas;
223 	baa.graphics.ctx = baa.graphics.canvas.getContext('2d');
224 	baa.graphics._defaultCtx = baa.graphics.ctx;
225 
226 	document.addEventListener("keydown",baa.keyboard._downHandler, false);
227 	document.addEventListener("keyup",baa.keyboard._upHandler, false);
228 	document.addEventListener("mousemove",baa.mouse._move, false);
229 	document.addEventListener("mousedown",baa.mouse._downHandler, false);
230 	document.addEventListener("mouseup",baa.mouse._upHandler, false);
231 	document.addEventListener("mousewheel",baa.mouse._wheelHandler, false);
232 }

234 /**
235  * baa.js is a library created by Daniël Haazen.
236  * @constructor
237  * @type {object}
238  */
239 baa = {};
240 
241 /**
242  * Whether to use type safety. Is turned off in release-mode.
243  * @type {boolean}
244  */
245 baa._typesafe = true;
246 
247 /**
248  * Checks if the type of obj is one of the given types, and throws an error if it's not
249  * @param  {string} name The name of the object
250  * @param  {object} obj  The object
251  * @param {dynamic} ... The allowed types
252  */
253 baa._checkType = function (name,obj) {
254 	if (!this._typesafe) { return; };
255 	var t = typeof(obj);
256 	if (t == arguments[2]) { return; };
257 	str = ""
258 	var type = obj == null ? null : Array.isArray(obj) ? "array" : t;
259 	var clss =  Class.isClass(obj);
260 	for (var i = 2; i < arguments.length; i++) {
261 		
262 		str = str + arguments[i];
263 		if (arguments[i] == type) {
264 			return;
265 		}
266 		else if (clss && (obj.is(arguments[i]))) {
267 			return;
268 		}
269 	
270 		if (i != arguments.length-1) {
271 			str = str + ", ";
272 		}
273 	}
274 	throw("Wrong type '" + type + "' for " + name + ". Correct types: " + str);
275 }

281 baa._assetsLoaded = 0;

285  * @type {number}

287 baa._assetsToBeLoaded = 0;

290  * The object containing information for deltatime
291  * @constructor
292  * @type {object}
293  */
294 baa._time = {dt:0,last:0};
295 
296 /**
297  * Returns the current time
298  * @return {number} The current time
299  */
300 baa._time.stamp = function () {
301 	return window.performance && window.performance.now ? window.performance.now() : new Date().getTime();
302 }
303 
304 /**
305  * The time of the previous loop
306  * @type {number}
307  */
308 baa._time.last = baa._time.stamp();

314 /**
315  * A point class. Containing an x and y.
316  * @constructor
317  * @property {number} x The horizontal position
318  * @property {number} y The vertical position
319  * @param  {number} [x=0] The horizontal position
320  * @param  {number} [y=x] The vertical position
321  * @type {Class}
322  */
323 baa.point = Class.extend("baa.point");
324 
325 
326 baa.point.init = function (x,y) {
327 	baa._checkType("x",x,"number",null);
328 	baa._checkType("y",y,"number",null);
329 	
330 	this.x = x || 0;
331 	this.y = y == null ? this.x : y;
332 }
333 
334 /**
335  * Sets the x and y of the point
336  * @param  {number} [x=0] The horizontal position
337  * @param  {number} [y=x] The vertical position
338  */
339 baa.point.set = function (x,y) {
340 	baa._checkType("x",x,"number",null);
341 	baa._checkType("y",y,"number",null);
342 
343 	this.x = x || 0;
344 	this.y = y == null ? this.x : y;
345 }
346 
347 /**
348  * Clones the x and y of another point
349  * @param  {baa.point} p The point to clone from
350  */
351 baa.point.clone = function (p) {
352 	baa._checkType("point",p,"baa.point");
353 
354 	this.x = p.x;
355 	this.y = p.y;
356 }
357 
358 /**
359  * If the point overlaps with a rectangle
360  * @param  {baa.rectangle} r The rectangle you want to check overlap with
361  * @return {boolean}   If there is overlap
362  */
363 baa.point.overlaps = function (r) {
364 	baa._checkType("rectangle",r,"baa.rect");
365 	return r.x + r.width > this.x && r.x < this.x
366 		&& r.y + r.height > this.y && r.y < this.y;
367 }

369 //Rect
370 //////////////////////////////////
371 
372 /**
373  * A rectangle class. Extends baa.point with a width and height.
374  * @constructor
375  * @property {number} width The width of the rectangle
376  * @property {number} height The height of the rectangle
377  * @property {object} color The color of the rectangle. Use an array of 3 numbers.
378  * @param {number} [x=0] The horizontal position
379  * @param {number} [y=x] The vertical position
380  * @param {number} [width=0] The width
381  * @param {number} [height=width] The height
382  * @type {Class}
383  */
384 baa.rect = baa.point.extend("baa.rect");
385 
386 baa.rect.init = function (x,y,width,height) {
387 	baa.rect.super.init(this,x,y);
388 	baa._checkType("width",width,"number",null);
389 	baa._checkType("height",height,"number",null);
390 
391 	this.width = width || 0;
392 	this.height = height == null ? this.width : height;
393 	this.color;
394 }
395 
396 /**
397  * Draws the rectangle
398  * @param  {string} [mode="fill"] Whether to use fill, line or both when drawing
399  * @param  {number} r    How much rounding to use
400  */
401 baa.rect.draw = function (mode,r) {
402 	if (this.color) {
403 		baa.graphics.setColor(this.color);
404 	}
405 	baa.graphics.rectangle(mode || "fill",this.x,this.y,this.width,this.height,r);
406 }
407 
408 /**
409  * Sets new values for the rectangle
410  * @param  {number} [x=0] The horizontal position
411  * @param  {number} [y=x] The vertical position
412  * @param {number} [width=0] The width
413  * @param {number} [height=width] The height
414  * @override
415  */
416 baa.rect.set = function (x,y,width,height) {
417 	baa.rect.super.set(this,x,y);
418 	baa._checkType("width",width,"number",null);
419 	baa._checkType("height",height,"number",null);
420 
421  	this.width = width;
422 	this.height = height == null ? width : height;
423 }
424 
425 /**
426  * Clones the values of another rectangle
427  * @param  {baa.rectangle} r The rectangle to clone from
428  * @override
429  */
430 baa.rect.clone = function (r) {
431 	baa._checkType("rect",r,"baa.rect");
432 
433 	this.x = r.x;
434 	this.y = r.y;
435 	this.width = r.width;
436 	this.height = r.height;
437 }
438 
439 /**
440  * Sets and returns the left side of the rectangle
441  * @param  {number} [x] The horizontal position you want the left side to be at
442  * @return {number}   The horizontal position the left side is at
443  */
444 baa.rect.left = function (x) {
445 	baa._checkType("x",x,"number",null);
446 
447 	if (x!=null) { this.x = x; }
448 	return this.x;
449 }
450 
451 /**
452  * Sets and returns the right side of the rectangle
453  * @param  {number} [x] The horizontal position you want the right side to be at
454  * @return {number}   The horizontal position the right side is at
455  */
456 baa.rect.right = function (x) {
457 	baa._checkType("x",x,"number",null);
458 
459 	if (x!=null) { this.x = x - this.width};
460 	return this.x + this.width;
461 }
462 
463 /**
464  * Sets and returns the top side of the rectangle
465  * @param  {number} [y] The vertical position you want the top side to be at
466  * @return {number}   The vertical position the top side is at
467  */
468 baa.rect.top = function (y) {
469 	baa._checkType("y",y,"number",null);
470 
471 	if (y!=null) { this.y = y; }
472 	return this.y;
473 }
474 
475 /**
476  * Sets and returns the bottom side of the rectangle
477  * @param  {number} [y] The vertical position you want the bottom side to be at
478  * @return {number}   The vertical position the bottom side is at
479  */
480 baa.rect.bottom = function (y) {
481 	baa._checkType("y",y,"number",null);
482 
483 	if (y!=null) { this.y = y - this.height};
484 	return this.y + this.height;
485 }
486 
487 /**
488  * Sets and returns the horizontal center of the rectangle
489  * @param  {number} [x] The horizontal position you want the horizontal center to be at
490  * @return {number}   The horizontal position the horizontal center is at
491  */
492 baa.rect.xCenter = function (x) {
493 	baa._checkType("x",x,"number",null);
494 
495 	if (x!=null) { this.x = x - this.width/2 };
496 	return this.x + this.width/2;
497 }
498 
499 /**
500  * Sets and returns the vertical center of the rectangle
501  * @param  {number} [y] The vertical position you want the vertical center to be at
502  * @return {number}   The vertical position the vertical center is at
503  */
504 baa.rect.yCenter = function (y) {
505 	baa._checkType("y",y,"number",null);
506 
507 	if (y!=null) { this.y = y - this.height/2 };
508 	return this.y + this.height/2;
509 }
510 
511 /**
512  * If the rectangle overlaps with another rectangle or point
513  * @param  {baa.rectangle|baa.point} r The rectangle or point you want to check overlap with
514  * @return {boolean}   If there is overlap
515  * @override
516  */
517 baa.rect.overlaps = function (r) {
518 	baa._checkType("rect",r,"baa.rect","baa.point");
519 	return this.x + this.width > r.x && this.x < r.x + (r.width || 0) 
520 		&& this.y + this.height > r.y && this.y < r.y + (r.height || 0) ;
521 }
522 
523 /**
524  * If the rectangle overlaps horizontally with another rectangle or point
525  * @param  {baa.rectangle|baa.point} r The rectangle or point you want to check horizontal overlap with
526  * @return {boolean}   If there is horizontal overlap
527  */
528 baa.rect.overlapsX = function (r) {
529 	baa._checkType("rect",r,"baa.rect","baa.point");
530 
531 	return this.x + this.width > r.x && this.x < r.x + r.width;
532 }
533 
534 /**
535  * If the rectangle overlaps vertically with another rectangle or point
536  * @param  {baa.rectangle|baa.point} r The rectangle or point you want to check vertical overlap with
537  * @return {boolean}   If there is vertical overlap
538  */
539 baa.rect.overlapsY = function (r) {
540 	baa._checkType("rect",r,"baa.rect","baa.point");
541 
542 	return this.y + this.height > r.y && this.y < r.y + r.height;
543 }

548 /**
549  * A circle class. Extends baa.point with a size
550  * @constructor
551  * @property {number} size The size of the circle
552  * @property {array} color The color of the circle. Use an array of 3 numbers.
553  * @param {number} [x=0] The horizontal position
554  * @param {number} [y=x] The vertical position
555  * @param {number} [size=0] The size
556  * @type {Class}
557  */
558 baa.circle = baa.point.extend("baa.circle");
559 
560 baa.circle.init = function (x,y,size) {
561 	baa.circle.super.init(this,x,y);
562 	baa._checkType("size",size,"number",null);
563 
564 	this.size = size || 0;
565 	this.color;
566 }
567 
568 /**
569  * Draws the circle
570  * @param  {string} mode Wether to use fill, line or both when drawing
571  */
572 baa.circle.draw = function (mode) {
573 	if (this.color) {
574 		baa.graphics.setColor(this.color);
575 	}
576 	baa.graphics.circle(mode || "fill",this.x,this.y,this.size);
577 }
578 
579 /**
580  * Sets new values for the circle
581  * @param  {number} [x=0] The horizontal position
582  * @param  {number} [y=x] The vertical position
583  * @param {number} [size=0] The size
584  * @override
585  */
586 baa.circle.set = function (x,y,size) {
587 	baa.circle.super.init(x,y);
588 	baa._checkType("size",size,"number",null);
589 
590 	this.size = size || 0;
591 }
592 
593 /**
594  * Clones the values of another circle
595  * @param  {baa.circle} r The circle to clone from
596  * @override
597  */
598 baa.circle.clone = function (c) {
599 	baa._checkType("circle",c,"baa.circle");
600 
601 	this.x = r.x;
602 	this.y = r.y;
603 	this.size = r.size;
604 }
605 
606 /**
607  * If the circle overlaps with another circle or point
608  * @param  {baa.circle|baa.point} r The circle or point you want to check overlap with
609  * @return {boolean}   If there is overlap
610  * @override
611  */
612 baa.circle.overlaps = function (r) {
613 	baa._checkType("circle",r,"baa.circle","baa.point");
614 
615 	return Math.sqrt(Math.pow(this.x - r.x,2) + Math.pow(this.y - r.y,2)) < this.size/2 + (r.size || 0)/2;
616 }

619 //Sprite
620 //////////////////////////////
621 
622 /**
623  * A sprite class. Extends baa.rectangle with image and animations.
624  * @constructor
625  * @property {baa.point} origin The point the object is rotated around and scaled to
626  * @property {baa.point} offset How far the image should be drawn from the hitbox
627  * @property {baa.point} scale How much the image should scale
628  * @property {number} alpha The opacity of the sprite. Use a value between 0 and 1.
629  * @property {number} angle The angle of the image in radians
630  * @property {boolean} flip If the image should be mirrored. Useful for characters walking left and right.
631  * @property {boolean} visible If the sprite should be drawn
632  * @property {baa._image} image The image to draw
633  * @property {array} _frames The frames the sprite has and can be used to make animations with
634  * @property {object} _animations The animations that are made
635  * @property {number} _animTimer Counts up during animation and rounds up to get current frame
636  * @property {number} _animTimerDir The direction _animTimer goes to. 1 for up, -1 for down.
637  * @property {number} _currentFrame At what frame the animation currently is
638  * @property {string} _currentAnim The animation currently in use
639  * @property {boolean} _animPlaying Whether the animation is playing at the moment
640  * @property {boolean} _animEnded Whether the animation has ended
641  * @param {number} [x=0] The horizontal position
642  * @param {number} [y=x] The vertical position
643  * @param {number} [width=0] The width
644  * @param {number} [height=width] The height
645  * @type {Class}
646  */
647 baa.sprite = baa.rect.extend("baa.sprite");
648 
649 baa.sprite.init = function (x,y,width,height) {
650 	baa.sprite.super.init(this,x,y,width,height);
651 	this.origin = baa.point.new(0,0);
652 	this.offset = baa.point.new(0,0);
653 	this.scale = baa.point.new(1,1);
654 	this.alpha = 1;
655 	this.angle = 0;
656 	this.flip = false;
657 	this.visible = true;
658 
659 	this.image;
660 	this._frames = [];
661 	this._animations = {}
662 	this._animTimer = 1;
663 	this._animTimerDir = 1;
664 	this._currentFrame = 1;
665 	this._currentAnim = "idle";
666 	this._animPlaying = true;
667 	this._animEnded = false;
668 }
669 
670 /**
671  * Updates the sprite
672  */
673 baa.sprite.update = function () {
674 	this.animate();
675 }
676 
677 /**
678  * Draws the image. If no image is assigned, it will draw a rectangle instead.
679  */
680 baa.sprite.draw = function () {
681 	if (this.visible) {
682 		if (this.image) {
683 			baa.graphics.setAlpha(this.alpha);
684 			this.image.draw(this._frames[this._currentFrame-1],
685 			this.x+this.offset.x + this.origin.x,this.y+this.offset.y + this.origin.y,
686 			this.angle,this.flip ? -this.scale.x : this.scale.x,this.scale.y,this.origin.x,this.origin.y);
687 			baa.graphics.setAlpha(1);
688 		}
689 		else {
690 			baa.sprite.super.draw(this);
691 		}
692 	}
693 }
694 
695 /**
696  * Sets the given image. Makes frames based on the given width and height. Automatically centers the origin based on the width and height.
697  * @example
698  * //The sprite's width and height become that of the image.
699  * this.setImage("player");
700  *
701  * //the image is cut down to smaller images, frames, that can be used for animations.
702  * this.setImage("player",16,16);
703  * @param {string} url    The url of the string
704  * @param {number} [width]  The width of the frames
705  * @param {number} [height] The height of the frames
706  * @param {boolean} [smooth] If the image should use smoothing when drawing
707  */
708 baa.sprite.setImage = function (url,width,height,smooth) {
709 	baa._checkType("url",url,"string");
710 	baa._checkType("width",width,"number",null);
711 	baa._checkType("height",height,"number",null);
712 	baa._checkType("smooth",smooth,"boolean",null);
713 
714 	this.image = baa.graphics.newImage(url,smooth);
715 	this.width = width || this.image.getWidth();
716 	this.height = height || this.image.getHeight();
717 	this._frames = [];
718 	for (var i=0; i < this.image.getHeight()/this.height; i++) {
719 		for (var j=0; j < this.image.getWidth()/this.width; j++) {
720 			this._frames.push({x:j*this.width,y:i*this.height,width:this.width,height:this.height});
721 		}
722 	}
723 	this.centerOrigin();
724 }
725 
726 /**
727  * Centers the origin. This is automatically called by setImage
728  */
729 baa.sprite.centerOrigin = function () {
730 	this.origin.x = this.width/2;
731 	this.origin.y = this.height/2;
732 }
733 
734 /**
735  * Adds an animation
736  * @param {string} name   The name of the animation
737  * @param {number[]} frames  The frames the animation. Use numbers between 1 and the number of frames.
738  * @param {number} [speed=12]  The speed the animations plays with
739  * @param {string} [mode="loop"]   The loop mode. "loop" for looping, "once" for the animation playing only once,
740  *  and "pingpong" for the animation to go back and forth.
741  * @param {number} [semi=0]	When ended, and looping, where the frame should start from instead. 
742  * Useful for animations with a starting animation you only want to play once.   
743  */
744 baa.sprite.addAnimation = function (name,frames,speed,mode,semi) {
745 	baa._checkType("name",name,"string");
746 	baa._checkType("frames",frames,"array");
747 	baa._checkType("speed",speed,"number",null);
748 	baa._checkType("mode",mode,"string",null);
749 	baa._checkType("semi",semi,"number",null);
750 
751 	var obj = {};
752 	obj.frames = frames;
753 	obj.numberOfFrames = frames.length;
754 	obj.speed = speed || 12;
755 	obj.mode = mode || "loop";
756 	obj.semi = semi || 1;
757 
758 	this._animations[name] = obj;
759 }
760 
761 /**
762  * Handles the animating. Is automatically called by update.
763  */
764 baa.sprite.animate = function () {
765 	if (this._animPlaying) {
766 		if (this._animations.hasOwnProperty(this._currentAnim)) {
767 			var anim = this._animations[this._currentAnim];
768 			if (anim.numberOfFrames == 1) {
769 				this._animTimer = 0;
770 				this._currentFrame = anim.frames[this._animTimer];
771 				return;
772 			}
773 
774 			if (typeof(anim.speed) == "number") {
775 				this._animTimer += anim.speed * this._animTimerDir * dt;
776 			}
777 			else {
778 				this._animTimer += anim.speed[this._currentFrame] * this._animTimerDir * dt;
779 			}
780 
781 			if (this._animTimer > anim.numberOfFrames+1 || this._animTimer < 1) {
782 				if (anim.mode == "loop") {
783 					this._animTimer = anim.semi;
784 					this._animEnded = true;
785 				}
786 				else if (anim.mode == "once") {
787 					this._animTimer = anim.finish;
788 					this._animPlaying = false;
789 					this._animEnded = true;
790 				}
791 				else if (anim.mode == "pingpong") {
792 					this._animTimer = this._animTimerDir > 0 ? anim.numberOfFrames : 2;
793 					this._animTimerDir = -this._animTimerDir;
794 				}
795 			}
796 
797 			this._currentFrame = anim.frames[Math.floor(this._animTimer)-1];
798 		}
799 	}
800 }
801 
802 /**
803  * Plays the animation
804  */
805 baa.sprite.playAnimation = function () {
806 	this._animPlaying = true;
807 }
808 
809 /**
810  * Pauses the animation
811  */
812 baa.sprite.pauseAnimation = function () {
813 	this._animPlaying = false;
814 }
815 
816 /**
817  * Stops the animation, and goes back to the first frame.
818  */
819 baa.sprite.stopAnimation = function () {
820 	this._animPlaying = false;
821 	this.setAnimationFrame(1);
822 }
823 
824 /**
825  * Sets the frame to 1, and plays the animation.
826  */
827 baa.sprite.replayAnimation = function () {
828 	this._animPlaying = true;
829 	this.setAnimationFrame(1);
830 	this._animEnded = false;
831 }
832 
833 /**
834  * Whether the animation has ended
835  */
836 baa.sprite.hasAnimationEnded = function () {
837 	return this._animEnded;
838 }
839 
840 /**
841  * Whether the animation is playing
842  */
843 baa.sprite.isAnimationPlaying = function () {
844 	return this._animPlaying;
845 }
846 
847 /**
848  * Sets the animation to be played. Has no effect when the current animation is the same as the given one. Unless you use force.
849  * @param {string} anim  The name of the animation
850  * @param {boolean} force Forces the animation to be set to the given animation, even when the current animiation is already the given one.
851  */
852 baa.sprite.setAnimation = function (anim, force) {
853 	baa._checkType("anim",anim,"string");
854 	baa._checkType("force",force,"boolean",null);
855 
856 	if (this._currentAnim != anim || force) {
857 		this._currentAnim = anim;
858 		this._animEnded = false;
859 		this._frameTimer = this._animations[anim].start;
860 		this._frameTimerDir = 1;
861 	}
862 }
863 
864 /**
865  * Returns the name of the current animation
866  * @return {string} The current animation
867 
868  */
869 baa.sprite.getAnimation = function () {
870 	return this._currentAnim;
871 }
872 
873 /**
874  * Sets the frame of the animation
875  * @throws {Error} If frame is higher than the number of frames the current animation has.
876  * @param {number} frame The frame to set
877  */
878 baa.sprite.setAnimationFrame = function (frame) {
879 	baa._checkType("frame",frame,"number");
880 
881 	var anim = this._animations[this._currentAnim];
882 	if (anim.numberOfFrames < frame) {
883 		throw("There are only " + anim.numberOfFrames +" frames. Not " + frame);
884 	}
885 	this._currentFrame = frame;
886 	this._frameTimer = frame;
887 }
888 
889 /**
890  * Returns the current frame
891  * @return {number} The current frame
892  */
893 baa.sprite.getAnimationFrame = function () {
894 	return this._currentFrame;
895 }

901 //Entity
902 //////////////////////////////
903 
904 /**
905  * An entity class. Extends baa.sprite with collision-handling and movement.
906  * @constructor
907  * @property {baa.rect} last The previous values of the entity. Useful for checking direction.
908  * @property {baa.point} velocity The velocity the entity moves with
909  * @property {baa.point} accel The amount the entity accelerates with. The higher the value, the fast the entity accelerates.
910  * @property {baa.point} drag The amount of drag the entity has. Is only used when accel[axis] is 0. The higher the value, the faster the entity slows down. 
911  * @property {baa.point} bounce How much the entity should bounce when colliding. 2 would make it go twice as fast.
912  * @property {number} separatePriority This decides which of the colliding entities will be moved from it's original position. The lower priority will be moved.
913  * @property {boolean} solid If false, the entity will not handle collision, and is not effected by other solid objects.
914  * @property {boolean} dead If true, the entity wil lstop updating and drawing, and has no collision anymore with other entities. 
915  * @param {number} [x=0] The horizontal position
916  * @param {number} [y=x] The vertical position
917  * @param {number} [width=0] The width
918  * @param {number} [height=width] The height
919  */
920 baa.entity = baa.sprite.extend("baa.entity");
921 
922 baa.entity.init = function (x,y,w,h) {
923 	baa.entity.super.init(this,x,y,w,h);
924 	this.last = baa.rect.new(x,y,w,h);
925 	this.velocity = baa.point.new();
926 	this.maxVelocity = baa.point.new(99999,99999);
927 	this.accel = baa.point.new();
928 	this.drag = baa.point.new();
929 	this.bounce = baa.point.new();
930 
931 	this.separatePriority = 0;
932 	this.solid = true;
933 	this.dead = false;
934 }
935 
936 /**
937  * Updates the entity
938  */
939 baa.entity.update = function () {
940 	baa.entity.super.update(this);
941 	this.updateMovement();
942 }
943 
944 /**
945  * Draws the entity. If baa.debug is active, it will call baa.entity.drawDebug as well.
946  */
947 baa.entity.draw = function () {
948 	baa.entity.super.draw(this);
949 	if (baa.debug && baa.debug.active) {
950 		this.drawDebug();
951 	}
952 }
953 
954 /**
955  * Draws debug lines. This is called when baa.debug is active.
956  */
957 baa.entity.drawDebug = function () {
958 	baa.graphics.setAlpha(1);
959 	baa.graphics.setLineWidth(2);
960 	baa.graphics.setColor(255,0,0);
961 	baa.graphics.rectangle("line",this.x,this.y,this.width,this.height);
962 }
963 
964 /**
965  * Updates the movement. Acceleration is added to the velocity. The position moves with velocity, and the velocity is lowered with drag.
966  */
967 baa.entity.updateMovement = function () {
968 	this.last.clone(this);
969 
970 	this.velocity.x += this.accel.x * dt;
971 	if (Math.abs(this.velocity.x) > this.maxVelocity.x) {
972 		this.velocity.x = this.maxVelocity.x * (this.velocity.x > 0 ? 1 : -1);
973 	}
974 	this.x += this.velocity.x * dt;
975 	if (this.accel.x == 0 && this.velocity.x != 0 && this.drag.x != 0) {
976 		if (this.drag.x * dt > Math.abs(this.velocity.x)) {
977 			this.velocity.x = 0;
978 		}
979 		else {
980 			this.velocity.x += this.drag.x * dt * (this.velocity.x>0 ? -1 : 1);
981 		}
982 	}
983 
984 	this.velocity.y += this.accel.y * dt;
985 
986 	if (Math.abs(this.velocity.y) > this.maxVelocity.y) {
987 		this.velocity.y = this.maxVelocity.y * (this.velocity.y > 0 ? 1 : -1);
988 	}
989 
990 	this.y += this.velocity.y * dt;
991 
992 	if (this.accel.y == 0 && this.velocity.y != 0 && this.drag.y != 0) {
993 		if (this.drag.y * dt > Math.abs(this.velocity.y)) {
994 			this.velocity.y = 0;
995 		}
996 		else {
997 			this.velocity.y += this.drag.y * dt * (this.velocity.y>0 ? -1 : 1);
998 		}
999 	}
1000 }
1001 
1002 /**
1003  * Checks if there is collision with the given entity, and calls baa.entity.onOverlap if so.
1004  * @param  {baa.entity} e The entity you want to check collision with
1005  */
1006 baa.entity.resolveCollision = function (e) {
1007 	if (this.overlaps(e)) {
1008 		this.onOverlap(e);
1009 	}
1010 }
1011 
1012 /**
1013  * Extends baa.rect.overlaps by checking if both entities aren't dead.
1014  * @param  {baa.entity} e The entity you want to check collision with
1015  * @return {boolean}   If there is collision
1016  */
1017 baa.entity.overlaps = function (e) {
1018 	return this!= e && !this.dead && !e.dead && baa.entity.super.overlaps(this,e);
1019 }
1020 
1021 /**
1022  * Called by baa.entity.resolveCollision when there is overlap. Calls baa.entity.separate if both entities are solid.
1023  * @param  {baa.entity} e The entity there is overlap with
1024  */
1025 baa.entity.onOverlap = function (e) {
1026 	if (this.solid && e.solid) {
1027 		this.separate(e);
1028 	} 
1029 }
1030 
1031 /**
1032  * Calls baa.entity.separateAxis. This wrapper handles the arguments it gives by checking if there was also overlap with this.last and e.last.
1033  * @param  {baa.entity} e The entity to separate from
1034  * @return {[type]}   [description]
1035  */
1036 baa.entity.separate = function (e) {
1037 	this.separateAxis(e, this.last.overlapsY(e.last) ? "x" : "y");
1038 }
1039 
1040 /**
1041  * Separates itself from the collided entity, or the other way around, based on their separatePriority.
1042  * @param  {baa.entity} e The entity to separate from
1043  * @param  {string} a The axis used to seperate from the entity
1044  */
1045 baa.entity.separateAxis = function (e, a) {
1046 	var s = (a == "x") ? "width" : "height";
1047 	if (this.separatePriority >= e.separatePriority) {
1048 		if ((e.last[a] + e.last[s] / 2) < (this.last[a] + this.last[s] / 2)) {
1049 			e[a] = this[a] - e[s];
1050 		}
1051 		else {
1052 			e[a] = this[a] + this[s];
1053 		}
1054 		e.velocity[a] = e.velocity[a] * -e.bounce[a];
1055 	}
1056 	else {
1057 		e.separateAxis(this, a);
1058 	}
1059 }
1060 
1061 
1062 //Button
1063 //////////////////////////////
1064 
1065 /**
1066  * A button that can call functions when you click on it. You can make the shape of the button either squared or round.
1067  * By default, buttons won't activate until you release them.
1068  * @constructor
1069  * @property {string} shape The shape of the button. The default shape can be set by changing baa.button.defaultShape.
1070  * @property {boolean} hold If the button is currently hold down.
1071  * @property {object} obj The object that is used for calling the function.
1072  * @property {function|string} func The function you want to call when the button is pressed.
1073  * @property {function|string} func The function you want to call when the button is pressed.
1074 *  @property {boolean} [onRelease=true] If the button should be activated on release. If this is false, it will be activated on press.
1075 *  @property {string|array} [buttons="l"] What button(s) can activate this button.
1076  * This can either be the name of the function as string, or a function on its own.
1077  * @param {number} x The horizontal position of the button. 
1078  * @param {number} y The vertical position of the button.
1079  * @param {object} [obj] The object that is used for calling the function.
1080  * @param {function|string} [func] The function you want to call when the button is pressed.
1081  * This can either be the name of the function as string, or a function on its own. 
1082  * @param {string} [shape] The shape of the button. The default shape can be set by changing baa.button.defaultShape.
1083  * @param {boolean} [onRelease=true] If the button should be activated on release. If this is false, it will be activated on press. 
1084  */
1085 baa.button = baa.sprite.extend("baa.button");
1086 
1087 /**
1088  * The default shape. This is normally "rectangle", but can be changed to "circle" if you have a lot of round buttons.
1089  */
1090 baa.button.defaultShape = "rectangle";
1091 
1092 baa.button.init = function (x,y,obj,func,shape,onRelease,buttons) {
1093 	baa.button.super.init(this,x,y);
1094 	baa._checkType("object",obj,"object");
1095 	baa._checkType("function",func,"function","string");
1096 	baa._checkType("shape",shape,"string",null);
1097 	this.shape = shape || baa.button.defaultShape;
1098 	this.hold = false;
1099 	this.obj = obj;
1100 	this.func = func;
1101 	this.onRelease = onRelease || true;
1102 	this.buttons = buttons || "l";
1103 }
1104 
1105 /**
1106  * Updates the button
1107  */
1108 baa.button.update = function () {
1109 	baa.button.super.update(this);
1110 	if (this.overlaps(baa.mouse)) {
1111 		baa.mouse.setCursor("hand");
1112 		this.setAnimation("hover");
1113 		if (baa.mouse.isPressed("l")) {
1114 			this.hold = true;
1115 		}
1116 	}
1117 	else {
1118 		this.setAnimation("idle");
1119 	}
1120 
1121 	if (this.hold) {
1122 		this.setAnimation("hold");
1123 	}
1124 
1125 	if ( ( this.onRelease && baa.mouse.isReleased("l") ) || (!this.onRelease && baa.mouse.isPressed("l")) ) {
1126 		if (this.hold && this.overlaps(baa.mouse)) {
1127 			this._active();
1128 			this.setAnimation("active");
1129 		}
1130 		this.hold = false;
1131 	} 
1132 }
1133 
1134 /**
1135  * Sets an image. The frames will be used to create the following animations:
1136  * "idle", when the mouse is not on the button. "hover", when you're hovering over the button.
1137  * "hold", when you're holding your mouse down on the button.  "release", when you release the button.
1138  * @param {string} url    The name of image.
1139  * @param {number} width  The width of each frame.
1140  * @param {nubmer} height The height of each frame.
1141  */
1142 baa.button.setImage = function (url,width,height) {
1143 	baa.button.super.setImage(this,url,width,height);
1144 	if (this.shape == "circle") {
1145 		this.offset.x = -this.origin.x;
1146 		this.offset.y = -this.origin.y;
1147 	}
1148 
1149 	var a1, a2, a3;
1150 	a1 = this._frames.length > 1 ? 2 : 1;
1151 	a2 = this._frames.length > 2 ? 3 : a1;
1152 	a3 = this._frames.length > 3 ? 4 : a2;
1153 	
1154 	this.addAnimation("idle",1,1);
1155 	this.addAnimation("hover",a1,a1);
1156 	this.addAnimation("hold",a2,a2);
1157 	this.addAnimation("active",a3,a3);
1158 }
1159 
1160 /**
1161  * This is called when the button is clicked, and calls the function that is set.
1162  */
1163 baa.button._active = function () {
1164 	baa.util.call(this.obj,this.func);
1165 }

1170 //Graphics
1171 
1172 /**
1173  * Handles everything you see on the screen
1174  * @constructor
1175  * @type {object}
1176  */
1177 baa.graphics = {};
1178 
1179 /**
1180  * The default context
1181  * @type {object}
1182  */
1183 baa.graphics._defaultCtx = null;
1184 
1185 /**
1186  * The default canvas
1187  * @type {object}
1188  */
1189 baa.graphics._defaultCanvas = null;
1190 
1191 /**
1192  * The default smoothing
1193  * @type {boolean}
1194  */
1195 baa.graphics._defaultSmooth = false;
1196 
1197 /**
1198  * The current canvas
1199  * @type {object}
1200  */
1201 baa.graphics._currentCanvas = null;
1202 
1203 /**
1204  * All the preloaded images
1205  * @see  baa.graphics.preload
1206  * @type {object}
1207  */
1208 baa.graphics._images = {};
1209 
1210 /**
1211  * The color to use with drawing
1212  * @see  baa.graphics.setColor
1213  * @type {object}
1214  */
1215 baa.graphics._color = {r:255,g:255,b:255,a:1};
1216 
1217 /**
1218  * The background color
1219  * @see  baa.graphics.setBackgroundColor
1220  * @type {object}
1221  */
1222 baa.graphics._backgroundColor = {r:0,g:0,b:0};
1223 
1224 /**
1225  * The current font
1226  * @type {baa.graphics._font}
1227  */
1228 baa.graphics._currentFont = null;
1229 
1230 /**
1231  * The width of the canvas
1232  */
1233 baa.graphics.width = 0;
1234 
1235 /**
1236  * The height of the canvas
1237  */
1238 baa.graphics.height = 0;
1239 
1240 /**
1241  * Use this to preload images. Assumes all images are in the folder images/
1242  * @param {string} ext The extension of the images. Examples: "png", "gif", "jpg"
1243  * @param {string} ... Names of the images. Example: "player", "logo", "enemy" NOT: "images/player.png", "images/logo", "enemy.png"
1244  */
1245 baa.graphics.preload = function (ext) {
1246 	var ext = "." + ext
1247 	for (var i = 1; i < arguments.length; i++) {
1248 		var name = arguments[i];
1249 		var img;
1250 		img = new Image();
1251 		img.onload = function(){
1252 			baa._assetsLoaded++;
1253 		}
1254 		img.src = "images/" + name + ext;
1255 		this._images[name] = img;
1256 		baa._assetsToBeLoaded++;
1257 		
1258 	}
1259 }
1260 
1261 //Drawing functions
1262 
1263 /**
1264  * Draws a rectangle
1265  * @param  {string} mode Whether to draw the rectangle filled, in lines, or both.
1266  * @param  {number|baa.rectangle} x    The horizontal position OR an object of type baa.rect. Using an object changes y in r, and ignores the other arguments.
1267  * @param  {number} [y]    The vertical position
1268  * @param  {number} [w]    The width
1269  * @param  {number} [h]    The height
1270  * @param  {number} [r]    The rounding
1271  */
1272 baa.graphics.rectangle = function (mode,x,y,w,h,r) {
1273 	baa._checkType("mode",mode,"string");
1274 	baa._checkType("x",x,"number","baa.rect");
1275 	
1276 
1277 	if (Class.isClass(x) && x.is(baa.rect)) {
1278 		r = y;
1279 		y = x.y;
1280 		w = x.width;
1281 		h = x.height;
1282 		x = x.x;
1283 	}
1284 
1285 	baa._checkType("y",y,"number");
1286 	baa._checkType("width",w,"number");
1287 	baa._checkType("height",h,"number");
1288 	baa._checkType("rounding",r,"number",null);
1289 
1290 	if (r==null) {
1291 		this.ctx.beginPath();
1292 		h = h==null ? w : h;
1293 		this.ctx.rect(x,y,w,h);
1294 		this._mode(mode);
1295 	}
1296 	else {
1297 		r = Math.min(7,Math.max(0,r));
1298 		r*=Math.min(w/25,h/25);
1299 		x += r;
1300 		w -= r*2;
1301 		y += r;
1302 		h -= r*2;
1303 		this.ctx.beginPath();
1304 		this.ctx.moveTo(x+r, y-r);
1305 		this.ctx.lineTo(x+w-r, y-r);
1306 		this.ctx.quadraticCurveTo(x+w+r, y-r, x+w+r, y+r);
1307 		this.ctx.lineTo(x+w+r, y+h-r);
1308 		this.ctx.quadraticCurveTo(x+w+r, y+h+r, x+w-r, y+h+r);
1309 		this.ctx.lineTo(x+r, y+h+r);
1310 		this.ctx.quadraticCurveTo(x-r, y+h+r, x-r, y+h-r);
1311 		this.ctx.lineTo(x-r, y+r);
1312 		this.ctx.quadraticCurveTo(x-r, y-r, x+r, y-r);
1313 		this._mode(mode);
1314 	}
1315 
1316 	if (baa.debug) { baa.debug.drawCalls++; };
1317 }
1318 
1319 /**
1320  * Draws a circle
1321  * @param  {string} mode Whether to draw the circle filled, in lines, or both.
1322  * @param  {number|baa.circle} x    The horizontal position OR an object of type baa.circle. Using an object ignores the other arguments.
1323  * @param  {number} y    The vertical position
1324  * @param  {number} r    The radius of the circle
1325  */
1326 baa.graphics.circle = function (mode,x,y,r) {
1327 	baa._checkType("mode",mode,"string");
1328 	baa._checkType("x",x,"number","baa.circle");
1329 
1330 	if (Class.isClass(x) && x.is(baa.circle)) {
1331 		y = x.y;
1332 		r = x.size;
1333 		x = x.x;
1334 	}
1335 
1336 	baa._checkType("y",y,"number");
1337 	baa._checkType("r",r,"number");
1338 
1339 	this.ctx.beginPath();
1340 	this.ctx.arc(x,y,Math.abs(r),0,2*Math.PI);
1341 	this._mode(mode);
1342 	this.ctx.closePath();
1343 
1344 	if (baa.debug) { baa.debug.drawCalls++; };
1345 }
1346 
1347 /**
1348  * Draws a convex
1349  * @param  {string} mode Whether to draw the convex filled, in lines, or both.
1350  * @param  {number} x    The horizontal position
1351  * @param  {number} y    The vertical position
1352  * @param  {number} r    The radius of the convex
1353  * @param  {number} p 	 The number of points the convex should have
1354  * @param  {number} rot  The rotation of the convex in radians
1355  */
1356 baa.graphics.convex = function (mode,x,y,r,p,rot) {
1357 	baa._checkType("mode",mode,"string");
1358 	baa._checkType("x",x,"number");
1359 	baa._checkType("y",y,"number");
1360 	baa._checkType("r",r,"number");
1361 	baa._checkType("p",p,"number");
1362 
1363 	p = Math.max(3,p);
1364 	this.ctx.beginPath();
1365 	for (var i = 0; i < p; i++) {
1366 		this.ctx.lineTo(x+Math.cos((i*(360/p))/180 *Math.PI + rot)*r,
1367 						y+Math.sin((i*(360/p))/180 *Math.PI + rot)*r);
1368 	}
1369 	this.ctx.lineTo(x+Math.cos((i*(360/p))/180 *Math.PI + rot)*r,
1370 					y+Math.sin((i*(360/p))/180 *Math.PI + rot)*r);
1371 	this._mode(mode);
1372 
1373 	if (baa.debug) { baa.debug.drawCalls++; };
1374 }
1375 
1376 /**
1377  * Draws a star
1378  * @param  {string} mode Whether to draw the star filled, in lines, or both.
1379  * @param  {number} x    The horizontal position
1380  * @param  {number} y    The vertical position
1381  * @param  {number} r1   The inner radius
1382  * @param  {number} r2   The outer radius
1383  * @param  {number} p    The number of points the star should have
1384  * @param  {number} r    The rotation of the star in radians
1385  */
1386 baa.graphics.star = function (mode,x,y,r1,r2,p,r) {
1387 	baa._checkType("mode",mode,"string");
1388 	baa._checkType("x",x,"number");
1389 	baa._checkType("y",y,"number");
1390 	baa._checkType("r1",r1,"number");
1391 	baa._checkType("r2",r2,"number");
1392 	baa._checkType("p",p,"number");
1393 	baa._checkType("r",r,"number",null);
1394 
1395 	r = r || 0;
1396 
1397 	p = Math.max(3,p);
1398 	this.ctx.beginPath();
1399 
1400 	for (var i = 0; i < p; i++) {
1401 		this.ctx.lineTo(x+Math.cos((i*(360/p))/180 *Math.PI + r)*r1,
1402 						y+Math.sin((i*(360/p))/180 *Math.PI + r)*r1);
1403 
1404 		this.ctx.lineTo(x+Math.cos((i*(360/p)+(180/p))/180 *Math.PI + r)*r2,
1405 						y+Math.sin((i*(360/p)+(180/p))/180 *Math.PI + r)*r2);
1406 
1407 	}
1408 	this.ctx.lineTo(x+Math.cos((i*(360/p))/180 *Math.PI + r)*r1,
1409 					y+Math.sin((i*(360/p))/180 *Math.PI + r)*r1);
1410 
1411 	this._mode(mode);
1412 
1413 	if (baa.debug) { baa.debug.drawCalls++; };
1414 }

1416 /**
1417  * Draws an arc, a part of a circle
1418  * @param  {string} mode Whether to draw the arc filled, in lines, or both.
1419  * @param  {number} x    The horizontal position
1420  * @param  {number} y    The vertical position
1421  * @param  {number} r    The radius of the arc
1422  * @param  {number} a1   The start of the arc
1423  * @param  {number} a2   The end of the arc
1424  */
1425 baa.graphics.arc = function (mode,x,y,r,a1,a2) {
1426 	baa._checkType("mode",mode,"string");
1427 	baa._checkType("x",x,"number");
1428 	baa._checkType("y",y,"number");
1429 	baa._checkType("r",r,"number");
1430 	baa._checkType("a1",a1,"number");
1431 	baa._checkType("a2",a2,"number");
1432 
1433 	this.ctx.beginPath();
1434 	this.ctx.lineTo(x,y);
1435 	this.ctx.arc(x,y,Math.abs(r),a1,a2);
1436 	this.ctx.lineTo(x,y);
1437 	this._mode(mode);
1438 	
1439 	if (baa.debug) { baa.debug.drawCalls++; };
1440 }

1442 /**
1443  * Draws a line
1444  * @param {array|number} points An array of numbers, x and y alternately, or a number, assuming all numbers are in arguments.
1445  * @param {number} ... The x and y of the points the lines goes to alternately
1446  */
1447 baa.graphics.line = function () {
1448 	this.ctx.beginPath();
1449 	if (typeof(arguments[0]) == "object") {
1450 		var verts = arguments[0];
1451 
1452 		baa._checkType("verts",verts[0],"number",null);
1453 		baa._checkType("verts",verts[1],"number",null);
1454 	
1455 		this.ctx.moveTo(verts[0],verts[1]);
1456 		for (var i = 0; i < verts.length-2; i+=2) {
1457 		
1458 			baa._checkType("verts",verts[i+2],"number",null);
1459 			baa._checkType("verts",verts[i+3],"number",null);
1460 		
1461 			this.ctx.lineTo(verts[i+2],verts[i+3]);
1462 		};
1463 		
1464 	}
1465 	else {
1466 		baa._checkType("verts",arguments[0],"number",null);
1467 		baa._checkType("verts",arguments[1],"number",null);
1468 		
1469 		this.ctx.moveTo(arguments[0],arguments[1]);
1470 		for (var i = 0; i < arguments.length-2; i+=2) {
1471 
1472 			baa._checkType("verts",arguments[i+2],"number",null);
1473 			baa._checkType("verts",arguments[i+3],"number",null);
1474 		
1475 			this.ctx.lineTo(arguments[i+2],arguments[i+3]);
1476 		};
1477 	}
1478 	this.ctx.stroke();
1479 
1480 	if (baa.debug) { baa.debug.drawCalls++; };
1481 }
1482 
1483 /**
1484  * Draws a polygon
1485  * @param  {string} mode Whether to draw the polygon filled, in lines, or both.
1486  * @param {array|number} points An array of numbers, x and y alternately, or a number, assuming all numbers are in arguments.
1487  * @param {number} ... The x and y of the points the polygon goes to alternately
1488  */
1489 baa.graphics.polygon = function (mode) {
1490 	baa._checkType("mode",mode,"string");
1491 	this.ctx.beginPath();
1492 	if (typeof(arguments[1]) == "object") {
1493 		var verts = arguments[1];
1494 
1495 		baa._checkType("verts",verts[1],"number",null);
1496 		baa._checkType("verts",verts[2],"number",null);
1497 	
1498 		this.ctx.moveTo(verts[1],verts[2]);
1499 		for (var i = 1; i < verts.length-2; i+=2) {
1500 		
1501 			baa._checkType("verts",verts[i+2],"number",null);
1502 			baa._checkType("verts",verts[i+3],"number",null);
1503 		
1504 			this.ctx.lineTo(verts[i+2],verts[i+3]);
1505 		};
1506 		
1507 	}
1508 	else {
1509 		baa._checkType("verts",arguments[1],"number",null);
1510 		baa._checkType("verts",arguments[2],"number",null);
1511 		
1512 		this.ctx.moveTo(arguments[1],arguments[2]);
1513 		for (var i = 0; i < arguments.length-2; i+=2) {
1514 
1515 			baa._checkType("verts",arguments[i+2],"number",null);
1516 			baa._checkType("verts",arguments[i+3],"number",null);
1517 		
1518 			this.ctx.lineTo(arguments[i+2],arguments[i+3]);
1519 		};
1520 	}
1521 	this.ctx.closePath();
1522 	this._mode(mode);
1523 
1524 	if (baa.debug) { baa.debug.drawCalls++; };
1525 }

1527 /**
1528  * Clears the canvas, and draws the background
1529  */
1530 baa.graphics.clear = function () {
1531 	this.push();
1532 	this.origin();
1533 	this.ctx.fillStyle = this._rgb(this._backgroundColor.r,this._backgroundColor.b,this._backgroundColor.g);
1534 	this.ctx.fillRect(0,0,this.canvas.width,this.canvas.height);
1535 	this.ctx.fillStyle = this._rgb(this._color.r,this._color.b,this._color.g);
1536 	this.pop();
1537 	if (baa.debug) { baa.debug.drawCalls++; };
1538 }

1540 /**
1541  * Draws text. If the second argument is a string, it will use alignment, else, it will assume the first argument is x.
1542  * @param  {string} t     The text to draw
1543  * @param  {string} [align] Use this for text-alignment. Options: "left", "center" and "right". 
1544  * Using a number here will take this argument as x, will take limit as y, and shift all the arguments.
1545  * @param  {string} [limit] [description]
1546  * @param  {number} [x=0]     The horizontal position
1547  * @param  {number} [y=x]     The vertical position
1548  * @param  {number} [r=0]     The rotation in radians
1549  * @param  {number} [sx=0]    The horizontal scaling
1550  * @param  {number} [sy=sx]    The vertical scaling
1551  * @param  {number} [ox=0]    The horizontal origin. The origin point is from where the text rotates and scales.
1552  * @param  {number} [oy=ox]    The vertical origin. The origin point is from where the text rotates and scales.
1553  * @param  {number} [kx=0]    The horizontal shearing factor
1554  * @param  {number} [ky=kx]    The vertical shearing factor
1555  */
1556 baa.graphics.print = function (t,align,limit,x,y,r,sx,sy,ox,oy,kx,ky) {
1557 	if (typeof(align) == "number") {
1558 		this._print(t,"left",align,limit,x,y,r,sx,sy,ox,oy);
1559 	}
1560 	else {
1561 		this._print(t,align,x,y,r,sx,sy,ox,oy,kx,ky,limit);
1562 	}
1563 
1564 	if (baa.debug) { baa.debug.drawCalls++; };
1565 }
1566 
1567 /**
1568  * Psst, baa.graphics.print is actually a wrapper, to call this function with the correct arguments. But don't tell anyone.
1569  */
1570 baa.graphics._print = function (t,align,x,y,r,sx,sy,ox,oy,kx,ky,limit) {
1571 	baa._checkType("text",t,"string","number",null);
1572 	baa._checkType("align",align,"string",null);
1573 	baa._checkType("x",x,"number",null);
1574 	baa._checkType("y",y,"number",null);
1575 	baa._checkType("r",r,"number",null);
1576 	baa._checkType("sx",sx,"number",null);
1577 	baa._checkType("sy",sy,"number",null);
1578 	baa._checkType("ox",ox,"number",null);
1579 	baa._checkType("oy",oy,"number",null);
1580 	baa._checkType("kx",kx,"number",null);
1581 	baa._checkType("ky",ky,"number",null);
1582 	baa._checkType("limit",limit,"number",null);
1583 
1584 	x = x == null ? 0 : x;
1585 	y = y == null ? x : y;
1586 	r = r == null ? 0 : r;
1587 	sx = sx == null ? 1 : sx;
1588 	sy = sy == null ? sx : sy;
1589 	ox = ox == null ? 0 : ox;
1590 	oy = oy == null ? ox : oy;
1591 	kx = kx == null ? 0 : kx;
1592 	ky = ky == null ? kx : ky;
1593 	this.ctx.textAlign=align;
1594 	if (limit!=null) {
1595 		var words = t.toString().split(' ');
1596 		var line = '';
1597 		for(var i = 0; i < words.length; i++) {
1598 			var testLine = line + words[i] + ' ';
1599 			var metrics = this.ctx.measureText(testLine);
1600 			var testWidth = metrics.width;
1601 			if (testWidth > limit && i > 0) {
1602 				this.ctx.save();
1603 				this.ctx.transform(1,ky,kx,1,0,0);
1604 				this.ctx.translate(x,y);
1605 				this.ctx.scale(sx,sy);
1606 				this.ctx.rotate(r);
1607 				this.ctx.fillText(line, -ox,-oy+this._currentFont.size);
1608 				this.ctx.restore();
1609 				line = words[i] + ' ';
1610 				y += this._currentFont.height+sy;
1611 			}
1612 			else {
1613 				line = testLine;
1614 			}
1615 		}
1616 	}
1617 	else {
1618 		line = t;
1619 	}
1620 	this.ctx.save();
1621 	this.ctx.transform(1,ky,kx,1,0,0);
1622 	this.ctx.translate(x,y);
1623 	this.ctx.scale(sx,sy);
1624 	this.ctx.rotate(r);
1625 	this.ctx.fillText(line, -ox,-oy+this._currentFont.size);
1626 	this.ctx.restore();
1627 	this.ctx.textAlign="left";
1628 }
1629 
1630 /**
1631  * Draws an image. If the second argument is an object, a quad, it will draw only part of the image. Else, it will assume the second argument is x.
1632  * @throws {Error} If img is a non-existing image.
1633  * @param  {baa.graphics._image|string} img  The image you want draw, or a string of the name of the image.
1634  * @param  {object} [quad] An object with an x, y, width and height. 0, 0, 32, 32 would be the top left part of the image, and a 32x32 rectangle. 
1635  * Using a number here will take this argument as x, and shift all the arguments.  
1636  * @param  {number} [x=0]     The horizontal position
1637  * @param  {number} [y=x]     The vertical position
1638  * @param  {number} [r=0]     The rotation in radians
1639  * @param  {number} [sx=0]    The horizontal scaling
1640  * @param  {number} [sy=sx]    The vertical scaling
1641  * @param  {number} [ox=0]    The horizontal origin. The origin point is from where the text rotates and scales.
1642  * @param  {number} [oy=ox]    The vertical origin. The origin point is from where the text rotates and scales.
1643  * @param  {number} [kx=0]    The horizontal shearing factor
1644  * @param  {number} [ky=kx]    The vertical shearing factor
1645  */
1646 baa.graphics.draw = function (img,quad,x,y,r,sx,sy,ox,oy,kx,ky) {
1647 	if (typeof(quad) != "object") {
1648 		this._draw(img,quad,x,y,r,sx,sy,ox,oy,kx,ky);
1649 	}
1650 	else{
1651 		this._draw(img,x,y,r,sx,sy,ox,oy,kx,ky,quad);
1652 	}
1653 
1654 	if (baa.debug) { baa.debug.drawCalls++; };
1655 }
1656 
1657 /**
1658  * Psst, baa.graphics.draw is actually a wrapper, to call this function with the correct arguments. But don't tell anyone.
1659  */
1660 baa.graphics._draw = function (img,x,y,r,sx,sy,ox,oy,kx,ky,quad) {
1661 	baa._checkType("image",img,"baa.graphics.image","string");
1662 	baa._checkType("x",x,"number",null);
1663 	baa._checkType("y",y,"number",null);
1664 	baa._checkType("r",r,"number",null);
1665 	baa._checkType("sx",sx,"number",null);
1666 	baa._checkType("sy",sy,"number",null);
1667 	baa._checkType("ox",ox,"number",null);
1668 	baa._checkType("oy",oy,"number",null);
1669 	baa._checkType("kx",kx,"number",null);
1670 	baa._checkType("ky",ky,"number",null);
1671 	baa._checkType("quad",quad,"object",null);
1672 	
1673 	var url = typeof(img) == "string" ? img : img.url;
1674 	if (this._images[url]==null) {
1675 		throw("The image " + img + " doesn't exist. Did you forget to preload it?");
1676 	}
1677 
1678 	x = x == null ? 0 : x;
1679 	y = y == null ? x : y;
1680 	r = r == null ? 0 : r;
1681 	sx = sx == null ? 1 : sx;
1682 	sy = sy == null ? sx : sy;
1683 	ox = ox == null ? 0 : ox;
1684 	oy = oy == null ? ox : oy;
1685 	kx = kx == null ? 0 : kx;
1686 	ky = ky == null ? kx : ky;
1687 
1688 	var smooth = img.smooth == null ? this._defaultSmooth : img.smooth;
1689 	this.ctx.imageSmoothingEnabled = smooth;
1690 	this.ctx.mozImageSmoothingEnabled = smooth;
1691 	this.ctx.oImageSmoothingEnabled = smooth;
1692 	this.ctx.save();
1693 	this.ctx.transform(1,ky,kx,1,0,0);
1694 	this.ctx.translate(x,y);
1695 	this.ctx.scale(sx,sy);
1696 	this.ctx.rotate(r);
1697 	if (quad) {
1698 		this.ctx.drawImage(this._images[url],quad.x,quad.y,quad.width,quad.height,-ox,-oy,quad.width,quad.height);
1699 	}
1700 	else{
1701 		this.ctx.drawImage(this._images[url],-ox,-oy);
1702 	}
1703 	this.ctx.restore();
1704 	this.ctx.imageSmoothingEnabled = this.defaultFilter == "linear";
1705 }

1712 /**
1713  * An image object. Makes it able to read data of the image, and set smoothing for specific images.
1714  * @constructor
1715  * @throws {Error} If url is a non-existing image.
1716  * @param {string} url The url of the image
1717  * @param {boolean} [smooth=null] The smoothing of the image.
1718  * @property {string} url The url of the image.
1719  * @property {boolean} smooth The smoothing of the image. If this is null, default smoothing will be used instead. This can be set with baa.graphics.setSmooth.
1720  */
1721 baa.graphics._image = Class.extend("baa.graphics.image");
1722 
1723 baa.graphics._image.init = function (url,smooth) {
1724 	baa._checkType("url",url,"string");
1725 	baa._checkType("smooth",smooth,"boolean",null);
1726 	if (baa.graphics._images[url]==null) { throw ("Image '" + url + "' doesn't exist. Did you forgot to preload it?")}
1727 	this.url = url;
1728 	this.smooth = smooth;
1729 }
1730 
1731 /**
1732  * Draws the image.
1733  * @see  baa.graphics.draw
1734  */
1735 baa.graphics._image.draw = function (quad,x,y,r,sx,sy,ox,oy,kx,ky) {
1736 	baa.graphics.draw(this,quad,x,y,r,sx,sy,ox,oy,kx,ky);
1737 }
1738 
1739 /**
1740  * Sets the smoothing of the image
1741  * @param {boolean} smooth If the image should use smoothing or not.
1742  */
1743 baa.graphics._image.setSmooth = function (smooth) {
1744 	baa._checkType("smooth",smooth,"boolean",null);
1745 	return this.smooth = smooth;
1746 }
1747 
1748 /**
1749  * Returns the current smoothing of the image. Returns null if no smoothing is assigned yet.
1750  * @return {boolean|null} The smoothing of the image
1751  */
1752 baa.graphics._image.getSmooth = function () {
1753 	return this.smooth;
1754 }
1755 
1756 /**
1757  * Returns the width of the image.
1758  * @return {number} The width of the image.
1759  */
1760 baa.graphics._image.getWidth = function () {
1761 	return baa.graphics._images[this.url].width;
1762 }
1763 
1764 /**
1765  * Returns the height of the image.
1766  * @return {number} The height of the image.
1767  */
1768 baa.graphics._image.getHeight = function () {
1769 	return baa.graphics._images[this.url].height;
1770 }
1771 
1772 /**
1773  * Creates a new image. This is used to keep image a private object.
1774  * @see  baa.graphics._image
1775  * @return {baa.graphics._image} The new image
1776  */
1777 baa.graphics.newImage = function (url,smooth) {
1778 	return this._image.new(url, smooth);
1779 }

1785 /**
1786  * A font object. Allows you to set the size and height of a font. Fonts are loaded in CSS.
1787  * @example
1788  *  <style>
1789  *  @font-face {
1790  *      font-family: "score";
1791  *      src: url(fonts/score.otf);
1792  *  }
1793  *  </style>
1794  *
1795  * baa.graphics.newFont("score",12);
1796  * @constructor
1797  * @alias baa.graphics.font
1798  * @param {string} name The name of the font.
1799  * @param {number} size The size of the font.
1800  * @param {string} [style="normal"] The style of the font. Options: "normal", "italic" and "oblique".
1801  * @param {number} [height=size*2]  The height of the font. This will be used when using alignment and limit for multilining.
1802  * @property {string} name The name of the font.
1803  * @property {number} size The size of the font.
1804  * @property {string} style The style of the font. Options: "normal", "italic" and "oblique".
1805  * @property {number} height  The height of the font. This will be used when using alignment and limit for multilining.
1806  */
1807 baa.graphics._font = Class.extend("baa.graphics.font");
1808 
1809 baa.graphics._font.init = function (name,size,style,height) {
1810 	baa._checkType("name",name,"string");
1811 	baa._checkType("size",size,"number");
1812 	baa._checkType("style",style,"string",null);
1813 	baa._checkType("height",height,"number",null);
1814 
1815 	this.name = name;
1816 	this.size = size;
1817 	this.style = style || "normal";
1818 	this.height = height==null ? size*2 : height;
1819 }

1830 }

1872 /**
1873  * Everything is drawn on a canvas. You can create your own canvas, draw stuff on that canvas, and then draw the canvas on the real canvas.
1874  * @constructor
1875  * @param {number} width The width of the canvas.
1876  * @param {number} height The height of the canvas.
1877  * @param {boolean} smooth If the cnavas should draw everything smooth on default.
1878  * @property {object} drawable The canvas itself.
1879  * @property {object} context The context of drawable. This is used to draw everything on the canvas.
1880  * @property {boolean} [smooth=false] If the canvas should draw everything smooth on default.  
1881  */
1882 baa.graphics._canvas = Class.extend("baa.graphics.canvas");
1883 
1884 baa.graphics._canvas.init = function (width,height,smooth) {
1885 	baa._checkType("width",width,"number");
1886 	baa._checkType("height",height,"number");
1887 	baa._checkType("smooth",smooth,"boolean",null);
1888 
1889 	this.drawable = document.createElement('canvas');
1890 	this.context = this.drawable.getContext('2d');
1891 	this.smooth = smooth || false;
1892 	width = Math.max(0,width);
1893 	height = Math.max(0,height);
1894 	this.drawable.width = width;
1895 	this.drawable.height = height;
1896 }

1899  * Returns the width of the canvas.

1912 }

1965 /**
1966  * Sets the default smoothing.
1967  * @param {boolean} smooth The default smoothing.
1968  */
1969 baa.graphics.setSmooth = function (smooth) {
1970 	baa._checkType("smooth",smooth,"boolean");
1971 	this._defaultSmooth = smooth;
1972 }
1973 
1974 /**
1975  * Sets the color the canvas uses to draw geometry. r, g, and b use numbers between 0 and 255. a (for alpha), uses a number between 0 and 1.
1976  * @param {number|array} r Red. If this is an array, the function assumes all numbers are in that array, and disregard all the other arguments.
1977  * @param {number} g Green.
1978  * @param {number} b Blue.
1979  * @param {number} a Alpha
1980  */
1981 baa.graphics.setColor = function (r,g,b,a) {
1982 	if (a && a > 1) { print("Warning: Alpha uses 0 to 1, not 0 to 255!"); }
1983 	if (typeof(r)=="object") {
1984 		baa._checkType("red",r[0],"number",null);
1985 		baa._checkType("green",r[1],"number",null);
1986 		baa._checkType("blue",r[2],"number",null);
1987 		baa._checkType("alpha",r[3],"number",null);
1988 		this._color.r = r[0];
1989 		this._color.g = r[1];
1990 		this._color.b = r[2];
1991 		this._color.a = r[3];
1992 	}
1993 	else {
1994 		baa._checkType("red",r,"number",null);
1995 		baa._checkType("green",g,"number",null);
1996 		baa._checkType("blue",b,"number",null);
1997 		baa._checkType("alpha",a,"number",null);
1998 
1999 		this._color.r = r==null ? this._color.r : r;
2000 		this._color.g = g==null ? this._color.g : g;
2001 		this._color.b = b==null ? this._color.b : b;
2002 		this._color.a = a==null ? this._color.a : a;
2003 	}
2004 	this.ctx.fillStyle = this._rgb(this._color.r,this._color.g,this._color.b);
2005 	this.ctx.strokeStyle = this._rgb(this._color.r,this._color.g,this._color.b);
2006 	this.ctx.globalAlpha = this._color.a;
2007 }
2008 
2009 /**
2010  * Sets the alpha the canvas uses to draw geometry and images.
2011  * @param {number} a The alpha, a number between 0 and 1.
2012  */
2013 baa.graphics.setAlpha = function (a) {
2014 	baa._checkType("alpha",a,"number");
2015 
2016 	this._color.a = Math.min(1,Math.max(0,a));
2017 	return this.ctx.globalAlpha = this._color.a;
2018 }
2019 
2020 /**
2021  * The same as setColor, except for the background. The background color can have no alpha. Uses numbers between 0 and 255.
2022  * @param {number|array} r Red. If this is an array, the function assumes all numbers are in that array, and disregard all the other arguments.
2023  * @param {number} g Green.
2024  * @param {number} b Blue.
2025  */
2026 baa.graphics.setBackgroundColor = function (r,g,b) {
2027 	if (typeof(r)=="object") {
2028 		baa._checkType("red",r[0],"number",null);
2029 		baa._checkType("green",r[1],"number",null);
2030 		baa._checkType("blue",r[2],"number",null);
2031 
2032 		this._backgroundColor.r = r[0] || this._backgroundColor.r;
2033 		this._backgroundColor.g = r[1] || this._backgroundColor.g;
2034 		this._backgroundColor.b = r[2] || this._backgroundColor.b;
2035 	}
2036 	else {
2037 		baa._checkType("red",r,"number",null);
2038 		baa._checkType("green",g,"number",null);
2039 		baa._checkType("blue",b,"number",null);
2040 
2041 		this._backgroundColor.r = r==null ? this._backgroundColor.r : r;
2042 		this._backgroundColor.g = g==null ? this._backgroundColor.g : g;
2043 		this._backgroundColor.b = b==null ? this._backgroundColor.b : b;
2044 	}
2045 }
2046 
2047 /**
2048  * Sets the line width the canvas uses to draw geometry. Is standard on 1.
2049  * @param {number} width The width of line.
2050  */
2051 baa.graphics.setLineWidth = function (width) {
2052 	baa._checkType("width",width,"number",null);
2053 
2054 	this.ctx.lineWidth = width;
2055 }

2057 /**
2058  * Combines baa.graphics.newFont and baa.graphics.setFont to be able to create and set a new font at the same time
2059  * @see baa.graphics.newFont
2060  * @see baa.graphics.setfont
2061  */
2062 baa.graphics.setNewFont = function (fnt,size,style,height) {
2063 	fnt = this.newFont(fnt,size,style,height);

2074

2076 	this.ctx.font = fnt.style + " " + fnt.size + "pt " + fnt.name;
2077

2080 /**
2081  * Sets the blend mode of the canvas. 
2082  * Options: "source-over", "source-in", "source-out", "source-atop", "destination-over", 
2083  * "destination-in", "destination-out", "destination-atop", "lighter", "darker", "copy", and "xor".
2084  * @param {string} mode the blend mode to set.
2085  */
2086 baa.graphics.setBlendMode = function (mode) {

2088

2092 /**
2093  * Sets the canvas all future draw operations will be drawn on.
2094  * @see  baa.graphics._canvas
2095  * @param {baa.graphics._canvas} cvs The canvas to set
2096  */
2097 baa.graphics.setCanvas = function (cvs) {
2098 	baa._checkType("canvas",cvs,"baa.graphics.canvas",null);
2099 
2100 	if (cvs==null) {
2101 		this.ctx = this._defaultCtx;
2102 		this.canvas = this._defaultCanvas;
2103 		this._currentCanvas = null;
2104 	}
2105 	else{
2106 		this.ctx = cvs.context;
2107 		this.canvas = cvs.drawable;
2108 		this._currentCanvas = cvs;
2109 	}
2110 }
2111 
2112 /**
2113  * Sets a rectangle on the canvas, that cuts off all graphics outside that box.
2114  * @param {number|null} x The horizontal position of the scissor. If this is null, it will remove the current scissor.
2115  * @param {number} y The vertical position of the scissor.
2116  * @param {number} width The width of the scissor
2117  * @param {number} height The height of the scissor
2118  */
2119 baa.graphics.setScissor = function (x,y,width,height) {
2120 	if (x!=null) {
2121 		baa._checkType("x",x,"number");
2122 		baa._checkType("y",x,"number");
2123 		baa._checkType("width",width,"number");
2124 		baa._checkType("height",height,"number");
2125 		this.push();
2126 		this.ctx.beginPath();
2127 		this.ctx.rect(x,y,width,height);
2128 		this.ctx.closePath();
2129 		this.ctx.clip();
2130 	}
2131 	else {
2132 		this.pop();
2133 	}
2134 }

2221 //Coordinate System
2222 
2223 /**
2224  * Removes all the translating, scaling, rotating  and shearing.
2225  */
2226 baa.graphics.origin = function () {
2227 	this.ctx.setTransform(1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0);
2228 }
2229 
2230 /**
2231  * Moves all drawing operations horizontal with x, and vertical with y. This also sets the origin for .rotate, .scale and .shear.
2232  * @param  {number} x The horizontal movement
2233  * @param  {number} y The vertical movement
2234  */
2235 baa.graphics.translate = function (x,y) {
2236 	baa._checkType("x",x,"number");
2237 	baa._checkType("y",y,"number",null);
2238 	y = y == null ? x : y;
2239 	this.ctx.translate(x,y);
2240 }
2241 
2242 /**
2243  * Rotates all the drawing operations. Note that this rotates the whole canvas (at the top left), and not each drawing operation on its own.
2244  * @param  {number} r The rotation is radians
2245  */
2246 baa.graphics.rotate = function (r) {
2247 	baa._checkType("r",r,"number");
2248 	this.ctx.rotate(r);
2249 }
2250 
2251 /**
2252  * Scales all the drawing operations. Note that this scales the whole canvas (at the top left), and not each drawing operation on its own.
2253  * @param  {number} x The horizontal scaling
2254  * @param  {number} y The vertical scaling
2255  */
2256 baa.graphics.scale = function (x,y) {
2257 	baa._checkType("x",x,"number");
2258 	baa._checkType("y",y,"number",null);
2259 	y = y == null ? x : y;
2260 	this.ctx.scale(x,y);
2261 }
2262 
2263 /**
2264  * Scales all the drawing operations. Note that this shears the whole canvas (at the top left), and not each drawing operation on its own.
2265  * @param  {number} x The horizontal shearing
2266  * @param  {number} y The vertical shearing
2267  */
2268 baa.graphics.shear = function (x,y) {
2269 	baa._checkType("x",x,"number");
2270 	baa._checkType("y",y,"number",null);
2271 	y = y == null ? x : y;
2272 	this.ctx.transform(1,y,x,1,0,0);
2273 }
2274 
2275 /**
2276  * Pushes all the current translating, rotating, scaling and shearing on a stack.
2277  */
2278 baa.graphics.push = function () {
2279 	this.ctx.save();
2280 }
2281 
2282 /**
2283  * Pops the highest stack, removing all translating, rotating, scaling and shearing on that stack.
2284  */
2285 baa.graphics.pop = function () {
2286 	this.ctx.restore();
2287 }

2289 //Utils
2290 
2291 /**
2292  * This is called after every geometry function, to draw the shape filled, in lines or both.
2293  * @param  {string} mode The fill mode. Options: "fill", "line", "both"
2294  * @throws {Error} If an invalid mode is used.
2295  */
2296 baa.graphics._mode = function (mode) {
2297 	baa._checkType("mode",mode,"string");
2298 
2299 	if (mode == "fill") {
2300 		this.ctx.fill();
2301 	}
2302 	else if (mode == "line") {
2303 		this.ctx.stroke();
2304 	}
2305 	else if (mode == "both") {
2306 		this.ctx.fill();
2307 		this.ctx.stroke();
2308 	}
2309 	else {
2310 		throw new Error("Invalid mode " + mode);
2311 	}
2312 }
2313 
2314 /**
2315  * Converts RGB to hex
2316  * @param  {number} r Red
2317  * @param  {number} g Green
2318  * @param  {number} b Blue
2319  * @return {string}   The color in hex
2320  */
2321 baa.graphics._rgb = function (r,g,b) {
2322 	var x = ((r << 16) | (g << 8) | b).toString(16);
2323 	return "#000000".substring(0, 7 - x.length) + x;
2324 }
2325 
2326 /**
2327  * Resets the font. This is called whenever a change to a font is made.
2328  */
2329 baa.graphics._resetFont = function () {
2330 	this.ctx.font = this._currentFont.size + "pt " + this._currentFont.name;
2331 }

2334 //Audio
2335 
2336 /**
2337  * The audio module takes care of everything you hear, and everything with sound. The audio, volume, pitch.
2338  * @constructor
2339  */
2340 baa.audio = {};
2341 
2342 /**
2343  * All the audio files.
2344  * @see  baa.audio.preload
2345  */
2346 baa.audio._sources = {};
2347 
2348 /**
2349  * The main volume. Whenever you start a source, the source's volume will be multiplied by the main volume.
2350  */
2351 baa.audio._masterVolume = 1;
2352 
2353 /**
2354  * Use this to preload audio. Assumes all audio are in the folder audio/
2355  * @param {string} ext The extension of the audio. Examples: "ogg", "mp3", "wav"
2356  * @param {string} ... Names of the audio. Example: "jump", "shoot", "hit" NOT: "audio/jump.ogg", "audio/shoot", "hit.wav"
2357  */
2358 baa.audio.preload = function () {
2359 	var ext = "." + arguments[0];
2360 	for (var i = 1; i < arguments.length; i++) {
2361 		var name = arguments[i];
2362 		var snd;
2363 		snd = new Audio();
2364 		snd.oncanplaythrough = function(){
2365 			baa._assetsLoaded++;
2366 		}
2367 		snd.src = "audio/" + name + ext;
2368 		this._sources[name] = snd;
2369 		baa._assetsToBeLoaded++;
2370 	}
2371 }
2372 
2373 //Recorder functions
2374 
2375 /**
2376  * Plays the given audio
2377  * @param  {baa.audio._source} source The audio to play
2378  */
2379 baa.audio.play = function (source) {
2380 	baa._checkType("source",source,"baa.audio.source");
2381 
2382 	source.audio.play();
2383 	source.stopped = false;
2384 	source.playing = true;
2385 }
2386 
2387 /**
2388  * Stops the given audio, and rewinds it.
2389  * @param  {baa.audio._source} source The audio to stop
2390  */
2391 baa.audio.stop = function (source) {
2392 	baa._checkType("source",source,"baa.audio.source");
2393 
2394 	source.audio.pause();
2395 	source.stopped = true;
2396 	source.playing = false;
2397 	source.audio.currentTime = 0;
2398 }
2399 
2400 /**
2401  * Rewinds the given audio.
2402  * @param  {baa.audio._source} source The audio to rewind
2403  */
2404 baa.audio.rewind = function (source) {
2405 	baa._checkType("source",source,"baa.audio.source");
2406 
2407 	source.audio.currentTime = 0;
2408 }
2409 
2410 /**
2411  * Pauses the given audio
2412  * @param  {baa.audio._source} source The audio to pause
2413  */
2414 baa.audio.pause = function (source) {
2415 	baa._checkType("source",source,"baa.audio.source");
2416 
2417 	source.audio.pause();
2418 	source.playing = false;
2419 }
2420 
2421 /**
2422  * Resumes the given audio
2423  * @param  {baa.audio._source} source The audio to resume
2424  */
2425 baa.audio.resume = function (source) {
2426 	baa._checkType("source",source,"baa.audio.source");
2427 
2428 	if (source.audio.currentTime > 0) {
2429 		source.audio.play();
2430 		source.playing = true;
2431 	}
2432 }

2435  * Sets the master volume. Whenever you start a source, the source's volume will be multiplied by the master volume.
2436  * @param {number} volume What you want the master volume to set to
2437  */
2438 baa.audio.setVolume = function (volume) {
2439 	baa._checkType("volume",volume,"number");
2440

2447 /**
2448  * An audio object. Makes it able to read data of the audio, and set the volume for specific audio.
2449  * @constructor
2450  * @throws {Error} If url is a non-existing source.
2451  * @param {string} url The url of the source
2452  * @param {boolean} stopped If the audio is stopped.
2453  * @param {boolean} playing If the audio is playing.
2454  */
2455 baa.audio._source = Class.extend("baa.audio.source");
2456 
2457 baa.audio._source.init = function (url) {
2458 	baa._checkType("url",url,"string");
2459 
2460 	if (baa.graphics._sources[url]==null) { throw ("Audio '" + url + "' doesn't exist. Did you forgot to preload it?")}
2461 	this.audio = baa.audio.sources[url];
2462 	this.stopped = false;
2463 	this.playing = false;
2464 }
2465 
2466 /**
2467  * Plays the audio.
2468  */
2469 baa.audio._source.play = function () {
2470 	var oVol = this.audio.volume;
2471 	this.audio.volume *= baa.audio.masterVolume;
2472 	this.audio.play();
2473 	this.stopped = false;
2474 	this.playing = true;
2475 	this.audio.volume = oVol;
2476 }
2477 
2478 /**
2479  * Stops the audio.
2480  */
2481 baa.audio._source.stop = function () {
2482 	this.audio.pause();
2483 	this.stopped = true;
2484 	this.audio.currentTime = 0;
2485 }
2486 
2487 /**
2488  * Pauses the audio.
2489  */
2490 baa.audio._source.pause = function () {
2491 	this.audio.pause();
2492 	this.playing = false;
2493 }
2494 
2495 /**
2496  * Resumes the audio.
2497  */
2498 baa.audio._source.resume = function () {
2499 	if (this.audio.currentTime>0) {
2500 		this.audio.play();
2501 		this.playing = true;
2502 	}
2503 }
2504 
2505 /**
2506  * Rewinds the audio
2507  */
2508 baa.audio._source.rewind = function () {
2509 	this.audio.currentTime = 0;
2510 }
2511 
2512 /**
2513  * Returns the volume of the audio.
2514  * @return {number} The volume of the audio
2515  */
2516 baa.audio._source.getVolume = function () {
2517 	return this.audio.volume;
2518 }
2519 
2520 /**
2521  * Sets the volume of the audio. 0 is no sound, 1 is full sound.
2522  * @param {number} volume What the volume to set to
2523  */
2524 baa.audio._source.setVolume = function (volume) {
2525 	baa._checkType("volume",volume,"number");
2526 
2527 	this.audio.volume = volume;
2528 }

2624 baa.keyboard = {};
2625

2709 /**
2710  * This is called every time a key is pressed
2711  * @param  {object} event The Event object. 
2712  */
2713 baa.keyboard._downHandler = function(event) {
2714 	event.preventDefault();
2715 	var keyPressed = baa.keyboard._constant[event.keyCode] || String.fromCharCode(event.keyCode).toLowerCase();
2716 	if (!baa.keyboard._keys[keyPressed]) {
2717 		baa.keyboard._pressed.push(keyPressed);
2718 		if (baa.keyPressed) {
2719 			baa.keyPressed(keyPressed);
2720 		}
2721 		if (baa.debug) {
2722 			baa.debug.keypressed(keyPressed,event.keyCode);
2723 		}
2724 	}
2725 	baa.keyboard._keys[keyPressed] = true;
2726 }
2727 
2728 /**
2729  * This is called every time a key is released.
2730  * @param  {object} event The Event object. 
2731  */
2732 baa.keyboard._upHandler = function(event) {
2733 	var keyReleased = baa.keyboard._constant[event.keyCode] || String.fromCharCode(event.keyCode).toLowerCase();
2734 	baa.keyboard._released.push(keyReleased);
2735 	if (baa.keyReleased) {
2736 		baa.keyReleased(keyReleased);
2737 	}
2738 	baa.keyboard._keys[keyReleased] = false;
2739 }
2740 
2741 /**
2742  * Returns if any of the given keys is currently down. You can give infinite arguments, or give an array as the first argument.
2743  * @return {string|array} ... The keys you want to check. If the first arugment is an array, 
2744  * it will check the strings in the array, and disregard all other arguments.
2745  */
2746 baa.keyboard.isDown = function() {
2747 	if (typeof(arguments[0]) == "object") {
2748 		arguments = arguments[0];
2749 	}
2750 	for (var i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++) {
2751 		baa._checkType("key",arguments[i],"string");
2752 		if (baa.keyboard._keys[arguments[i]]) {
2753 			return true;
2754 		}
2755 	}
2756 	return false;
2757 }
2758 
2759 /**
2760  * Returns if any of the given keys has just been pressed. You can give infinite arguments, or give an array as the first argument.
2761  * @return {string|array} ... The keys you want to check. If the first arugment is an array, 
2762  * it will check the strings in the array, and disregard all other arguments.
2763  */
2764 baa.keyboard.isPressed = function () {
2765 	for (var i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++) {
2766 		baa._checkType("key",arguments[i],"string");
2767 		for (var j = 0; j < this._pressed.length; j++) {
2768 			if (arguments[i] == this._pressed[j]) {
2769 				return true;
2770 			}
2771 		}
2772 	}
2773 	return false;
2774 }
2775 
2776 /**
2777  * Returns if any of the given keys has just been released. You can give infinite arguments, or give an array as the first argument.
2778  * @return {string|array} ... The keys you want to check. If the first arugment is an array, 
2779  * it will check the strings in the array, and disregard all other arguments.
2780  */
2781 baa.keyboard.isReleased = function () {
2782 	for (var i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++) {
2783 		baa._checkType("key",arguments[i],"string");
2784 		for (var j = 0; j < this._released.length; j++) {
2785 			if (arguments[i] == this._released[j]) {
2786 				return true;
2787 			}
2788 		}
2789 	}
2790 	return false;
2791 }
